Department: Saw Swee Hock School Of Public Health
ModuleDescription:
This module will equip the students in skills to conduct different forms
of programme evaluations (formative/summative, process/outcome/impact, cost effectiveness analysis etc) in different contexts (as an internal or external evaluator of a programme). The students will acquire practical skills on how to prepare for an evaluation, conduct an evaluation and appropriately disseminate the evaluation results to the relevant stakeholders.
Prerequisite:
SPH5002 Public Health Research Methods OR CO5102 Principles of
Epidemiology and CO5103 Quantitative Epidemiologic Methods
